## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an 'x' -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the [Kotlin coding conventions](https://kotlinlang.org/docs/coding-conventions.html)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have removed unnecessary comments and debug code
- [ ] My code has no new warnings or errors

### Testing

- [ ] I have tested this on a physical device
- [ ] I have tested this on an emulator
- [ ] I have added/updated unit tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested on multiple Android versions (if applicable)
- [ ] I have tested both portrait and landscape orientations (if UI changes)

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation (README.md, SPEC.md, etc.)
- [ ] I have updated inline code documentation (KDoc)
- [ ] I have added/updated relevant comments
- [ ] My changes generate no new build warnings

### Security

- [ ] I have reviewed my code for security vulnerabilities
- [ ] I have not hardcoded any sensitive information (passwords, API keys, etc.)
- [ ] I have properly validated user input
- [ ] I have followed secure coding practices

### Accessibility

- [ ] I have tested with TalkBack (if UI changes)
- [ ] I have added content descriptions for new UI elements
- [ ] My changes work well with large text sizes
- [ ] My changes work well in high contrast mode

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have not added new dependencies (or have justified them below)
- [ ] All dependencies are from trusted sources
- [ ] I have updated Gradle dependencies if needed

### Build & CI

- [ ] My code compiles without errors
- [ ] `./gradlew test` passes
- [ ] `./gradlew lint` passes with no new warnings
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline passes
